First release in the line and first release from the Universal Century timeline. Features the Core Block Transformation and Combination System. Includes fully transformable FF-X7 Core Fighter, a non-transformable Core Block, and an Amuro Ray figurine. Kits from RG-01 to RG-13 use a base adapter that is compatible with  Action Base 2 only.
Features a gear mechanism that moves the monoeye when the head is turned sideways. Includes Char Aznable figurine.
Includes Kira Yamato figurine. First release from the Cosmic Era timeline.
Parts and color variant of RG-02. Includes Zeon pilot figurine.
Includes Kira Yamato figurine. Full Burst Effect Parts are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit.
Accessory kit to convert RG-03 into GAT-X105+AQM/E-X02 Sword Strike Gundam or GAT-X105+AQM/E-X03 Launcher Strike Gundam. Includes Striker Pack hanger for Action Base.
Includes Titans pilot figurine and optional parts to create "test" version. Shield features missile pod as seen in the Zeta Gundam compilation films.
Color variant of RG-07 without optional parts. Includes Kamille Bidan figurine. Originally planned to be released simultaneously with RG-07, but mold defects caused a delayed release date.
Includes Athrun Zala figurine and display stand for Fatum-00.

Shield features missile pod as seen in the Zeta Gundam compilation films. Includes grenade launcher packs, Action Base 2 adapter for MS and Wave Rider modes, and Kamille Bidan figurine. First transformable MS in the line.
Includes Shinn Asuka figurine. Released to coincide with the Gundam SEED Destiny HD Remaster.
Features the Core Block Transformation and Combination System. Includes fully transformable FF-XII Core Fighter II and Kou Uraki (EFSF uniform) figurine.
Parts variant of RG-12. Includes fully transformable FF-XII-Fb Core Fighter II Full Burnern and Kou Uraki (flight jacket) figurine.

Features gold-colored Advanced MS Joint parts and gold chrome plated parts. Includes Kira Yamato figurine. The first RG kit to use a base adapter that is compatible with both Action Base 1 and 2, as well as peg-based display stands.
Features chrome plated GN Swords. Includes Setsuna F. Seiei figurine. First release from the Anno Domini timeline.
Includes Char Aznable figurine.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz

info.notes: Includes Heero Yuy figurine. First release from the After Colony timeline.
Includes parts to create the GN-0000RE+GNR-010 00 Raiser GN Condenser Type, as well as Setsuna F. Seiei and Saji Crossroad figurines.
Features multicolor Advanced MS Joint parts and chrome plated "Gerbera Straight" katana. Includes Lowe Guele figurine.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing Endless Waltz: The Glory of Losers

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 00 The Movie -A wakening of the Trailblazer-

info.notes: Includes clear adjustable stand for GN Sword V in buster rifle mode and Setsuna F. Seiei figurine.
Features gloss coating and gold chrome plated parts. Includes Full Frontal figurine. Rocket Bazookas and additional optional parts are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit.

name: GAT-X105B/FP Build Strike Gundam Full Package

info.notes: Uses the B, C, and F plate runners of RG-03. Includes Sei Iori figurine. First release from the Build Fighters timeline. Also the first RG kit to have bilingual Japanese/English text on its box packaging and instruction manual.

name: MBF-P01-Re2AMATU Gundam Astray Gold Frame Amatsu Mina

info.notes: Parts and color variant of RG-19. Features gloss coated armor parts. Includes clear adjustable stand for "Magashira no Hoko" Harpoon and Rondo Mina Sahaku figurine.

Advanced MS Joint features clear colored parts. Includes optional non-transformable antennas in Unicorn and Destroy Modes and Banagher Links figurine. Transforms from Unicorn Mode to Destroy Mode with minor parts-forming on the head and feet. Released to coincide with the grand opening of The Gundam Base Tokyo and as part of the Gunpla Evolution Project.
Parts and color variant of RG-02. Includes Johnny Ridden figurine.

Parts and color variant of RG-25 with yellow Psycho-Frame. Includes Riddhe Marcenas figurine. As an undocumented feature, includes all parts to create RX-0 Unicorn Gundam 02 Banshee featured in Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn (Novel), which can be built by following RG-25's instructions for all steps except for the head.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz

info.notes: Includes Zechs Merquise figurine and additional clear blades for the beam sabers.

Features "Invoke Mode" originally introduced in the Master Grade Ver.Ka kit. Includes Char Aznable (Neo Zeon uniform) figurine. Initial release includes Universal Century New Gunpla Book magazine. First RG kit packaged in a double size box similar to a MG kit. Released to commemorate the 30th anniversary of Char's Counterattack and as part of Bandai's "UC NexT 0100" project.
Enhanced version of RG-25 with green Psycho-Frame. Includes Hyper Beam Javelin. Largest RG retail kit to date.
Includes fully transformable Core Fighter, Anti-Beam Coating Cloak, and Kincade Nau figurine. First release from Late Universal Century timeline. Released as part of the Gunpla Evolution Project.
Includes Amuro Ray (Londo Bell Normal Suit) figurine and custom Action Base adapter.

Can be separated into Chest Flyer and Leg Flyer. Includes transformable YFX-M56S Core Splendor, Silhouette Flyer, two Action Base adapters for MS mode/Leg Flyer and Chest Flyer, and Shinn Asuka figurine.
Includes gray Action Base 5. From this kit onward, pilot figurine is not included in regular RG kits.
Fully transformable kit.

Redesign of RG-01 with improved articulation and proportions. Features the Core Block Transformation and Combination System. Includes fully transformable FF-X7 Core Fighter. Additional weapons are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit. First Ver.2.0. for the RG line; also the first RG kit to not feature Advanced MS Joint frame. Released to commemorate the 45th anniversary of the Mobile Suit Gundam anime.

Redesign of MG-003 with improved articulation and proportions. Features a gear mechanism that moves the monoeye when the head is turned sideways and a swivel mechanism that moves the cockpit left or right. Utilizes an assembly system for the cables where the individual rings slide through a rod or spring. Includes Missile Pods and Zeon pilot figurine. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-40/59.

Includes Rolan Cehack figurine, transformable Core Fighter, and a cow figurine to replicate scenes from the anime. "Moonlight Butterfly" effect parts are sold separately with P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit. First MG kit from the Correct Century timeline. Selected by poll to be the 100th MG released. First MG kit to have stencilled letters on the runners rather than embossed to aid identification.
Includes display base and Shinn Asuka and Stella Loussier figurines. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-43.

Includes Banagher Links figurine. Beam Gatling Gun and Armed Armor DE were sold separately. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-44. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing Endless Waltz: The Glory of Losers

info.notes: Includes Milliardo Peacecraft figurine. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-98. First official Katoki redesign of the Gundam Epyon. Fully transformable kit.
Includes Riddhe Marcenas and Audrey Burne figurines, and additional parts to support the frame in Wave Rider mode. Fully transformable kit.

Parts variant of MG-145. Includes Setsuna F. Seiei (civilian outfit) figurine and original parts to combine the two GN Katars into arm-mounted or handheld twin edge weapon. Chest, GN Drives, and GN Buster Sword II accommodate Gunpla LED Units (sold separately).

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing Endless Waltz: The Glory of Losers

info.notes: Uses the XA and XB plate runners of MG-138. Includes Quatre Raberba Winner figurine, Heat Shotel and Beam Machine Gun. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-99.

Parts variant of MG-102 with green Psycho-Frame and Y plate runner for improved knee articulation and leg hardpoints for Grenade racks. Includes Banagher Links figurine, two MG-exclusive Hyper Beam Javelin, and parts to create Type 94 Base Jabber (includes two Earth Federation pilot figurines) for normal Unicorn Gundam. Armed Armor DE was sold separately.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing Endless Waltz: The Glory of Losers

info.notes: Uses the XA and XB plate runners of MG-138. Includes Trowa Barton figurine, optional shield piece for Gatling Gun and hidden Beam Saber. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-100.

Includes Yzak Jule figurine and Bazooka that was not seen in the TV series. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately with MG ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam G.U.N.D.A.M. Edition. Released in conjunction with Gundam SEED Remaster project.
Features a specialized Inner Frame system. Includes Flit Asuno figurine and parts to create AGE-1F Gundam AGE-1 Flat. First MG kit from the Advanced Generation timeline.
Parts variant of MG-153.

Parts and color variant of MG-102 with yellow Psycho-Frame; F plate runners are renewed for improved knee articulation. Includes articulated Armed Armor VN/BS and Marida Cruz figurine, as well as a leftover Banagher Links figurine from MG-102. Released to coincide with release of the 5th episode of the OVA.
Parts variant of MG-153.

Includes Titans pilot figurine, "round forming joint" custom attachment for Action Base 1, and adapter parts for the optional Ballute System. Upper torso accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately).
Uses the B, C, D, E, and F plate runners of MG-152. Includes two Nicol Amalfi figurines. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately with MG ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam G.U.N.D.A.M. Edition.
Includes Asemu Asuno figurine. Fully transformable kit.
Uses the B, C, D, E, and F plate runners of MG-152. Includes Dearka Elsman figurine. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately with MG ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam G.U.N.D.A.M. Edition.
Includes Athrun Zala figurine. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately with MG ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam G.U.N.D.A.M. Edition. Fully transformable kit.
Parts and color variant of MG-159. Includes Captain Ash figurine. Fully transformable kit.

Redesign of MG-034 with improved articulation and proportions. Uses Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner, a new preassembled hand design dual-molded in ABS and polypropylene for high articulation. Features "Invoke Mode" gimmick, which consists mainly of a green Psycho-Frame (transformation requires removal of some armor parts). Includes Amuro Ray (blue uniform) figurine, an Amuro insignia display base from MG-095, effect parts for the Fin Funnels, and water slide decal sheet. Neck accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately). Released to commemorate the 25th anniversary of Char's Counterattack. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing Endless Waltz: The Glory of Losers

info.notes: Features the spring-loading gimmick on the Dober Gun. Includes Zechs Merquise (TV version) figurine.
Parts and color variant of MG-116. Uses Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner. Includes Rocket Bazooka and water slide decal sheet.
Parts and color variant of MG-139. Includes Earth Federation pilot figurine and extra backpack to create RGZ-95C ReZEL Type C [Defenser A-Unit] [GR]. Fully transformable kit.

Color variant of MG-116, with inner frame materials changed from ABS to polystyrene, hence reducing the risk of peg breakage that modelers experienced with the original kit. Includes Rocket Bazooka of MG-165 with a different handle, and water slide decal sheet. First MG kit to use entirely polystyrene.
Uses Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner. Includes Londo Bell Tri-Stars pilot figurine. Upper torso accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately).

Redesign of MG-065 with improved articulation and proportions. Includes Kira Yamato and Mu La Flaga figurines, stand from MG-065, MG-090 (Re-color version) and MG-108, and battery pack to create GAT-X105+AQM/E-YM1 Perfect Strike Gundam. Uses the B, C, D, E, and F plate runners of MG-152. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-91 and bundled with MG ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam G.U.N.D.A.M. Edition.
Parts variant of MG-159.
Includes Neo Zeon pilot figurine. Neck accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately). Last kit to use the Ver.1.0 box and instruction manual format.

Uses the D and K plate runners of MG-111, and Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner. Includes Amuro Ray figurine. Upper torso accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately). Beam Javelin, Gundam Hammer and water slide decal sheet are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit; water slide decal sheet is also sold separately as GD-97.
First MG Ver.3.0 kit, part of the evolution of the MG Line, where greater articulation is achieved using a new armor on inner frame placement design. Like the Real Grade version, this kit is modeled after the 1/1 scale RX-78-2 Gundam statue. Released to commemorate the 35th anniversary of Gundam.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Desiny Remastered

info.notes: Color variant of MG-169; redesign of MG-074 with improved articulation and proportions. Includes Cagalli Yula Athha figurine, and Ootori first seen in the opening of Phase 14 of SEED Destiny Remastered. Compatible with the Aile Striker from MG-169, the I.W.S.P. from MG-090 and MG-104, and both Sword and Launcher Striker from MG-108.

name: XXXG-00W0 Wing Gundam Proto Zero EW

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam Wing Endless Waltz: Glory of the Losers

info.notes: Includes BA-2 display base with adapter for Neo Bird mode and a Heero Yuy figurine. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-93. First official Katoki redesign of the Wing Gundam Zero TV Version. Fully transformable kit.

Redesign of MG-029 with improved articulation and proportions. First and currently the only regular release MG kit to use Emotion Manipulator SP (MP2) plate runner, a new hand design using the same dual molding technique as the earlier Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner. Features "Invoke Mode", which consists of opening armor hatches. Includes Long Rifle seen in illustrations, Char Aznable figurine, and water slide decal sheet. Neck accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately). Funnel effect parts are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit.

name: GAT-X105B/FP Build Strike Gundam Full Package

info.notes: Parts variant of MG-169. Includes Build Booster and multipurpose connector parts for other MG kits, and Sei Iori figurine, as well as a leftover Kira Yamato pilot figure from MG-169. Compatible with all MG Striker packs. First MG kit from the Gundam Build Fighters series.
Includes Garrod Ran figurine, clear parts and plated stickers for the Microwave Reflectors. First MG kit from the After War era.
Parts variant of MG-130. Includes Oni no Tate and multipurpose connector parts for other MG kits, and Nils Nielsen figurine.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam UC: One of Seventy Two

info.notes: Parts and color variant of MG-155. Includes water slide decal sheet and a leftover Banagher Links figurine from MG-102. First regular release chrome plated MG kit since MG-037.
Color variant of MG-082. Launchpad replaced by MG Build Booster Mk-II. Includes Reiji an the original kit's figurines, and multipurpose connector parts for other MG kits.
Accessory kit for MG-176. Includes BA-1 display base, extra parts to convert MG-176 into GAT-X105B/ST Star Build Strike Gundam, effect parts, and multipurpose connector parts for other MG kits.
Includes Gym Ghingham figurine, custom stand for "Bloody Siege" attack, and effect part for "Shining Finger". Uses entirely polystyrene except for the stand, which is ABS.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children

info.notes: Uses the F, I, and R plate runners of MG-163, and Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner; redesign of MG-095 with improved articulation and proportions closer to the original lineart. Includes Amuro Ray figurine, an Amuro insignia display base from MG-095, prop stand for backpack, effect parts for the Fin Funnels, and water slide decal sheet. Neck accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately). Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.

name: MBF-P03D Gundam Astray Blue Frame D

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny Astray B

info.notes: Parts and color variant of MG-125. Includes display base and Gai Murakumo and Elsa Weiss figurines. Formation Base for DRAGOON units is sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit.

Parts and color variant of MG-123. Includes Meijin Kawaguchi the 3rd figurine, Dark Matter Booster and multipurpose connector parts for other MG kits. Dark Matter Booster accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately).
Uses the B and C plate runners of MG-177. Includes Garrod Ran and Tiffa Adill figurines, clear parts and plated stickers for the Microwave Reflectors.

Redesign of MG-037 with improved articulation and proportions. Armor pieces feature metallic gold painted over clear white plastic. Includes two Quattro Bajeena figurines, and parts to attach to Ballute System. Shares weapon parts with RE-04. Mega Bazooka Launcher and water slide decal sheet is sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit. Released to commemorate the 30th anniversary of Zeta Gundam.
Uses the F, G, and H plate runners of MG-132. Includes Ricardo Fellini figurine and a redesigned BA-13 Action Base 1. Fully transformable kit.
Parts and color variant of MG-111. Includes Meijin Kawaguchi the 3rd figurine. First MG kit from the Gundam Build Fighters Try series.

Uses the I plate runner of MG-111, and Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner. Includes Amuro Ray figurine, and effect parts for the shoulder and forearm guns. Upper torso accommodates Gunpla LED Unit (sold separately). First MG kit from the Mobile Suit Gundam: The Origin series.

Includes two Gundam heads, two Core Fighters with clear attachments for Action Base 1, a Shahkti Kareen figurine, and water slide decal sheet. "Wings of Light" effect parts are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit. Fully transformable kit.

Redesign of MG-072 with improved articulation and proportions. Includes BA-2 display base and Kira Yamato figurine. Effect parts and water slide decal sheet are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit; water slide decal sheet is also bundled with MG ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam G.U.N.D.A.M. Edition. Uses entirely polystyrene. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.

Features polyethylene joint seals and a functional emergency pod. Includes display base, Io Fleming figurine, and water slide decal sheet. Beam Rifle and Hyper Bazooka are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit. Released to coincide with the Blu-ray release of Mobile Suit Gundam Thunderbolt: December Sky. Reissues from 2024 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.

name: MS-06R Zaku II High Mobility Type "Psycho Zaku" [Gundam Thunderbolt] "Ver.Ka"

info.notes: Parts and color variant of MG-103. Features polyethylene joint seals. Includes Base 5 display base, stand for propellant tank, Daryl Lorenz figurine, and water slide decal sheet (metallic silver in initial releases of the kit). First MG kit to have bilingual Japanese/English text on its box packaging and instruction manual.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

info.notes: Uses the H, I, and J plate runners of MG-111 and the MP plate runner of MG-153. Features WP plate runner, which is a universal weapons runner for some MG Earth Federation kits. Includes Earth Federation pilot figurine. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-118.

Uses the I and J plate runners of MG-192. Uses entirely polystyrene except for the cables, which are TPE. Includes effect parts for DRAGOON units, BA-2 display base, and Rau Le Creuset figurine. Additional effect parts for DRAGOON units and water slide decal sheet are sold separately as P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit.
Uses the I and J plate runners of MG-192. Includes BA-13 Action Base 1, Action Base 1 adapters for the Gundam and Fatum-00 unit, and Athrun Zala figurine. Uses entirely polystyrene.

Redesign of MG-026 with improved articulation and proportions. Features silver metallic detail parts. Includes two transformable FXA-07GB Neo Core Fighters, Action Base 1 adapter for Core Top, Judau Ashta figurine (Double Beam Rifle features Iino Abbav figurine), and water slide decal sheet. Released to commemorate the 30th anniversary of Gundam ZZ. Fully transformable kit.
Parts and color variant of MG-118. Includes Earth Federation pilot figurine.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

info.notes: Parts and color variant of MG-195. Color variant of MG RGM-79GS GM Command Space with a different backpack. Water slide decal sheet is sold separately as GD-118. The 200th MG release. Originally planned to be released in January 2018.[3]

Parts and color variant of MG-102; F plate runners are renewed for improved knee articulation. Re-release of MG RX-0 Unicorn Gundam 02 Banshee "Ver.Ka" (Final Battle Ver.) with yellow Psycho-Frame. Includes water slide decal sheet and a leftover Banagher Links figurine from MG-102, but no Marida Cruz or Riddhe Marcenas figurine.
Parts and color variant of MG-060. Includes display base. Released to commemorate the 30th anniversary of Gundam Sentinel. Largest MG release to date.

Redesign of MG-087 with improved articulation and proportions. Features metallic detail parts. Includes two heads (transformable and non-transformable), Cecily Fairchild figurine, and a gray custom base using a black Action Base 4/5 hexagon as platform. Chest vents and backpack thrusters accommodate Gunpla Lighting Unit (sold separately) via the custom base. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.

Uses the MP plate runner of MG-153. Uses entirely polystyrene. Unlike majority of the MG kits, no character figurine is included. Released to commemorate the 30th anniversary of Char's Counterattack and as part of Bandai's "UC NexT 0100" project.

Re-release of MG-140 with GN Sword IV Full Saber, new antenna and a modified backpack unit, but without Action Base 2. Includes Setsuna F. Seiei figurine and clear Action Base 5 for GN Sword IV Full Saber. Released to commemorate the 10th anniversary of Gundam 00.

Color variant of MG-165 with new "Sleeves" parts. Uses Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner. Includes Grenade Launcher, a pair of lengthened External Propellant Tanks and leftover Full Frontal pilot and standing figurines from MG-165, but no Zoltan Akkanen figurine.
Uses entirely polystyrene, except for the GN Cables, which are EVAC. GN Drive accommodates two Gunpla LED Units (sold separately). Includes Lockon Stratos (with Haro) figurine.

Parts and color variant of MG-159, with shoulder joints revised for improved articulation and stability. Includes Kyoya Kujo figruine, as well as a leftover Asemu Asuno figurine from the original kit. Fully transformable kit. First release from the Build Divers timeline.

name: MSA-0011[Ext] Ex-S Gundam / MSA-0011 S Gundam

info.notes: Parts and color variant of MG-055 and MG-060; either of the two units can be built at any time. Uses head, shoulder, chest, and backpack of MG-202 with redesigned abdomen parts and new fixed hands for various poses (effectively a de facto Ver.1.5 but not labelled). Transforms via complex parts-forming. Includes clear display base, cables for INCOM units, and a marking sheet designed by Hajime Katoki.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

info.notes: Redesign of MG-022 with improved articulation and proportions; uses the K plate runner of MG-111. Features polyethylene joint seals. Includes hyper bazooka, broken V-fin as seen in episode 4 of the OVA, optional headgear based on the SD Gundam BB Senshi versions, and Alfred Izuruha, Bernard Wiseman, and Christina Mackenzie (pilot suit) figurines. Released to commemorate the 30th anniversary of Gundam 0080.

name: ZGMF-1000/A1 Gunner ZAKU Warrior (Lunamaria Hawke Custom)

info.notes: Includes Lunamaria Hawke figurine. Leg hoses are preassembled using ABS-PP dual-molding technique. Uses entirely polystyrene except for the leg and backpack hoses. Released to commemorate the 15th anniversary of Gundam SEED Destiny.

Uses entirely polystyrene. Features plated sliver cylinders and gold inner frame parts; clear green parts for eyes and clear pink parts for emblems. Mace features two detachable blades. Includes Smoothbore Gun and Mikazuki Augus figurine. First release from the Post Disaster timeline. Originally planned to be released in November 2019, but was delayed due to unspecified reasons.[4]
Parts and color variant of MG-198; redesign of MG-042 with improved articulation and proportions. Includes water slide decal sheet. Uses H2 runner from MG 151.
Includes two GN Hand Missile Units and Allelujah Haptism figurine. GN Drive accommodates two Gunpla LED Units (sold separately). Fully transformable kit.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz

info.notes: Redesign of MG-075 with improved articulation and proportions. Includes black BA-13 Action Base 1, and Heero Yuy figurine. Released to commemorate the 25th anniversary of Gundam Wing. Fully transformable kit. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.
Uses the C and D plate runners of MG-211. Includes ZAFT pilot figurine. Uses entirely polystyrene.

Uses the I and J plate runners of MG-192 and entirely polystyrene. Includes black BA-13 Action Base 1. Fully transformable kit. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.
Removal of armor parts reveals GN-004 Gundam Nadleeh. Includes two Tieria Erde (pilot suit and evening gown) figurines.

Parts variant of MG-021 (effectively a de facto Ver.1.5 but not labelled) with revised inner frame from P-Bandai exclusive MG MS-09G Dwadge and some revised armor pieces. Uses Emotion Manipulator SP (MP2) plate runner. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.

Parts variant of MG-219; enhanced version of MG-023 (effectively a de facto Ver.1.5 but not labelled) with revised inner frame from P-Bandai exclusive MG MS-09G Dwadge and some revised armor pieces. Uses Emotion Manipulator SP (MP2) plate runner.

Redesign of MG-083 with improved articulation and anime-accurate proportions. Fully transformable kit. Features metallic silver frame parts and fully functional landing gear in Wave Rider mode. Includes Grenade Launcher packs and Kamille Bidan figurine. Released to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the Ver.Ka label. Originally planned to be released in February 2023, but was delayed due to unspecified reasons.[5]

Includes transformable Core Fighter, Beam Rifle with addtional parts to convert to Jegan's Beam Rifle, parts to create RX-9 Narrative Gundam and RX-9/C Narrative Gundam C-Packs (NT-D Deactivated), Jona Basta figurine, and water slide decal sheet. Psycho-Frame also compatible with MG-102 and all other variants of MG RX-0 Unicorn Gundam.
Parts and color variant of MG-206. Includes Grenade Launcher, Large Beam Axe, Zoltan Akkanen figurine, and water slide decal sheet.
Handguns feature movable slides. Rifle feature detachable magazine. Includes Gaelio Bauduin (standing and sitting) figurines.

Originally announced at the 41st Shizuoka Hobby Show 2002, with the prototype model on display at the event. Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement.
Originally announced at the 41st Shizuoka Hobby Show 2002, with the prototype model on display at the event. Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement.
Originally announced at the 41st Shizuoka Hobby Show 2002, with the prototype model on display at the event. Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement.
Parts variant of MG-049. Originally announced at the 41st Shizuoka Hobby Show 2002, with the prototype model on display at the event. Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement.

name: PF-78-1 Perfect Gundam (Katsumi Kawaguchi Produce Version)

info.notes: Color variant of MG-067. Originally announced at the 43rd Shizuoka Hobby Show 2004, with the prototype model on display at the event. Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement.

Development announced at the 45th Shizuoka Hobby Show 2006, with a modified version of the original 1990 Gundam F90 kit displayed as a prototype.[6] Plans for this kit did not go beyond this announcement. A new MG kit was released in August 2019 as a P-Bandai exclusive after the release of MG-203.
Tentative release announced at the 47th Shizuoka Hobby Show 2008 with the prototype model on display.[7] Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement

name: GN-001 Gundam Exia Roll Out Color

info.notes: Color variant of MG-123. Originally announced at Gunpla Big Expo Tokyo 2009 as a Bandai Hobby Online Shop exclusive, with the prototype model on display.[8] Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children

info.notes: Originally announced at Gunpla Expo World Tour 2010 Japan, with the prototype model on display at the event. Plans to release this model were canceled, but it resurfaced in 2014 as the first Reborn-One Hundred kit.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 00 The Movie -A wakening of the Trailblazer-

Redesign of MG-102 with improved articulation and proportions. Uses the N and O plate runners of MG-102, Q plate runner of MG-150, S, T, U and W plate runners of MG RX-0 Unicorn Gundam HD Color + MS Cage, and Emotion Manipulator SP (MP1) plate runner. Includes three Shield Funnels, MS Cage display stand, Banagher Links, Audrey Burne, Marida Cruz and two Cardeas Vist (standing and falling pose respectively) figurines, and water slide decal sheet. First Version Katoki release of MGEX. Most expensive MG regular release to date. Fully compatible with MG-150's full armor equipment.

First Gundam type PG kit. Features LED for eyes (requires one CR1220 watch battery). Includes transformable FF-X7 Core Fighter and optional Core Block. First Gunpla kit to use "Earth Federation Space Force (E.F.S.F.)" as the official moniker for the Earth Federation Forces.
First Zeon Unit and sole mass production unit PG kit. Features LED for monoeye (requires one CR1220 watch battery). First Gunpla kit to use the official "Principality of Zeon" moniker.
Color variant of PG-02.

First fully transformable PG kit. Features diecast metal landing gear, LED for eyes and stabilizer (requires one CR1220 watch battery each), wing binders (uses provided BR435 pin type battery for testing), beam saber (includes one BR435 pin type battery), and shield (requires two LR44 watch batteries). Includes grenade launcher packs.

series.name: New Mobile Report Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz

info.notes: First and only PG kit released from the After Colony timeline. Features diecast metal joints and LED for eyes and chest (requires two LR43 watch batteries).
Features diecast metal hip joint and LED for eyes and cockpit (requires two LR43 watch batteries).
Color variant of PG-06.

Includes parts to build either variant of the Gundam GP01. Features LED for eyes (requires one CR1220 watch battery) and diecast metal hip joint. Includes FF-XII Core Fighter II and FF-XII-Fb Core Fighter II Full Burnern, 90mm Machine Gun as seen in episodes 2 and 3 of the OVA, MS hangar, and figurines of Kou Uraki and two hangar personnel. Initial release of the kit included an Anaheim Electronics Gundam Project folder with Project GP01 Staff card.

First PG kit released from the Cosmic Era timeline. Features LED for eyes (requires one CR1220 watch battery) and diecast parts for the knees and hips. Includes Kira Yamato figurine and large "Grand Slam" sword weapon, promoted in Gundam Evolve 08.
Add-on kit for PG-09. Includes adjustable display base that is compatible with this kit or PG-09 and a pilot figure that can be painted as Mu La Flaga, Tolle Koenig, or Cagalli Yula Athha.

name: MBF-02+AQM/E-X01 Aile Strike Rouge + FX-550 Skygrasper

info.notes: Color variant of PG-09 with PG-10.

First PG kit released from a manga series. Re-uses inner frame of PG-09. Features LED for eyes (requires one CR1220 watch battery). Includes Lowe Guele figurine and a chapter of the Gundam SEED Astray manga. Initial release included clear armor parts, "Tiger Pierce" katana, and a stand to hold both the "Gerbera Straight" and "Tiger Pierce" katanas.

First PG kit released from the Anno Domini timeline. Features Gunpla LED Unit for eyes (two LR41 watch batteries included) and two GN Drives with lights and spinning flywheels (two CR2032 watch batteries included). GN Condensers on the arms and legs feature locking joints to support the weight of large weaponry and the 0 Raiser. Includes Setsuna F. Seiei and Saji Crossroad figurines. Initial release included 2 Way Stand Base for both 00 Gundam and 00 Raiser.

First PG kit designed by Hajime Katoki. Features LED for eyes (requires two LR41 watch batteries) and frame parts molded in three shades of gold (chrome plated, metallic painted, and injection molded). Includes Kira Yamato figurine and BA-7 display base. With wings spread out, it is the largest PG kit.

Fully transformable from Unicorn Mode to Destroy Mode and kit-exclusive Destroy Mode Unchained. V-fin halves use internal magnets to connect in Unicorn Mode. Includes custom display base with weapon storage ports and a Banagher Links figurine.
Parts and color variant of PG-15; also features a Destroy Unchained mode. Includes Riddhe Marcenas figurine.

Includes Setsuna F. Seiei (normal suit, holding helmet) figurine, optional GN Condenser unit and display base that doubles as weapons storage and can hold the GN Drive separately. Released to commemorate the 10th anniversary of Gundam 00 and the 20th anniversary of the Perfect Grade line. Part of the Gunpla Evolution Project.

Parts variant of PG-13 with redesigned chest, yellow head antennas, and shoulders. Includes two Gunpla LED Units (requires two LR41 watch batteries per unit) for eyes and GN Buster Sword II, and clear BA-13 Action Base 1. Two CR2032 watch batteries required for GN Drives. Released to commemorate the 10th anniversary of Gundam 00.

Parts and color variant of PG-09. Features new head and armor parts with increased details and improved proportions, as well as silver metallic frame and armor parts. Includes additional Mu La Flaga figurine.
Accessory kit for PG-01. Contains clear armor parts for the head, torso, waist block, left arm, and left leg, plus a light-up beam saber.
Accessory kit for PG-01. Contains clear armor parts for the shoulder, waist plates, right arm, and right leg, plus two hyper bazookas, a beam javelin, and a Gundam Hammer.
Accessory kit for PG-02/03. Contains clear armor parts for the head, arms, lower legs, and feet, plus two bazookas, a chain hammer, and a beam javelin.
Accessory kit for PG-02/03. Contains clear armor parts for the torso and thighs, plus a light-up heat hawk, two leg-mounted missile launchers, and two panzerfausts.
Clear armor parts for PG-13.
Set of 30 LEDs (one for the head, 29 for the Psycoframe) for PG-15, PG-16, and Unicorn Gundam 03 Phenex. Requires four AA batteries.
Set of LEDS for PG-17's inner frame that changes to green, blue, and red (requires four AA batteries on display base).

Color variant of PG-12 featuring gold chrome plated frame parts. Originally announced at a hobby show, with the prototype model on display (with one sample possessed by Dengeki Hobby).[2] Plans to release this model never went beyond this announcement.

name: RX-0 Unicorn Gundam Bande Dessinee Ver.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn - Bande Dessinee

info.notes: P-Bandai re-release of PG-15 with a color variant of PG-16's Armed Armor DE.

First release of the Unleashed sub-line. Redesign of PG-01 with improved articulation and proportions. Features an array of metallic and chrome plated parts, plus metal parts and etching stickers. Uses dual-molded inner frame similar to that in Advanced MS Joint of Real Grade. Beam Rifle and Shield are mounted by magnets. Lighting unit powers up head and chest lights (requires two LR41 watch batteries). Beam Saber features LED gimmick that can alternately light up the thrusters when mounted on the backpack (one BR435 lithium battery included). Includes Amuro Ray and Sayla Mass figurines. Released as part of the Gunpla Evolution Project.

name: Clear Color Body for RX-78-2 Gundam

info.notes: P-Bandai exclusive accessory kit for PGU-01 with clear armor parts. Includes water slide decal sheet.

Las Vegas Grand Prix exclusive color variant of PGU-01 to promote the Formula One team Scuderia AlphaTauri. Not for sale.
Tmall.com and JD.com exclusive color variant of PGU-01.
The first HGUC kit ever released. Includes Spray Missiles.
First 1/144 scale kit to use a detachable clear colored beam effect part for its beam saber.
First HGUC kit to use chrome plated parts. Plate runners use "undergating" arrangement, visually reducing the amount of nub marks during assembly. Includes dry transfer sheet with two "百" markings.
First HGUC kit to not include decal sheet.
Color variant of HGUC-004.
Compatible with the "Weapons for Mobile Suit" kit of the 1985 Zeta Gundam Gunpla series. Later reissues have the pelvis part B7 molded with a rectangular hole to accommodate an Action Base 2.
First Gundam released in the HGUC line. Includes non-transformable FF-XII Core Fighter II and 90mm Machine Gun as seen in episodes 2 and 3 of the OVA.
Parts and color variant of HGUC-003.
First transformable/separable HGUC kit.
Parts variant of HGUC-013. Includes non-transformable FF-XII-Fb Core Fighter II Full Burnern.
Color variant of HGUC-006.

Redesign of HG-01 with improved articulation and proportions. Includes non-transformable FF-X7 Core Fighter. The first HGUC Gundam to use clear colored beam saber effect parts; this would not be standard on HGUC Gundams until 2005.

First HGUC kit to include a display base. Fingers are compatible with MG beam saber effect parts. Reissues from 2023 onwards are molded in Ecopla, which is plastic recycled from materials discarded during the production of regular Gunpla.
Not transformable unlike its MG counterpart. Includes non-transformable FXA-08GB G-Core. G-Attacker unit sold separately as EX-05.
Features deployable folding arms. Includes non-transformable FF-XII-Sp Core Fighter II-Sp.
Parts and color variant of HGUC-016.
Parts and color variant of HGUC-017. Includes open left hand, rear skirt thruster, and additional weapons and ammo.
Enhanced version of HGUC-025. Uses diecast metal frame parts. The longest (1m × 0.5m × 0.6m) and most expensive non-bundled HGUC kit to date.
Parts variant of HGUC-023. Not transformable unlike its MG counterpart.
First kit to have a right hand and beam saber molded as a single piece. Includes marking sheet for units 01-03. Later reissues include the modified foot parts introduced in HGUC-050.
Color variant of HGUC-015. Fully transformable kit.
First 1/144 scale Zaku II kit to feature a movable monoeye (removal of helmet is required to adjust monoeye).
Color variant of HGUC-010.
Color variant of HGUC-032. Includes Magella Top Cannon, larger Heat Hawk, and a different head part with vulcan guns. First HGUC kit from 'MSV'.

Color variant of HGUC-030 with fully transformable FXA-05D G-Defenser; redesign of HG-03 with improved articulation and proportions. First HGUC kit to introduce Mobile Armors in size proportional to the Mobile Suits. Later reissues include the modified foot parts introduced in HGUC-050.

info.notes: Last HGUC kit to have a non-functional beam saber handle.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

info.notes: Color variant of HGUC-032. Includes two leg-mounted missile pods.

Redesign of HG-02 with improved articulation and proportions. Includes grenade launchers and Hyper Mega Launcher with landing gear. First HGUC kit to transform via parts-swapping; also the last HGUC kit to have a right hand and beam saber molded as a single piece.
Fully transformable kit. Includes booster unit and display base.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

info.notes: Released to coincide with the 15th anniversary of Mobile Suit Gundam 0080.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

Enhanced version of HGUC-005; molded in golden yellow instead of gold chrome plated. Mega Bazooka Launcher is fully transformable with minor parts swapping. Includes custom display base. Compatible with linkage part of HGUC-061.
Fully transformable kit. Largest HGUC kit before the release of HGUC-181.
Enhanced verson of HGUC-021. Feet are modified to allow docking with the G-Fighter; backpack is also modified to hold the beam sabers more firmly. Includes display base.

series.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

info.notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-046.
First kit to include a peg in the right weapon hand for extra security.

Re-release of HGUC-035 with Flying Armor instead of G-Defenser. Feet use modification introduced in HGUC-50. Includes display base for Flying Armor and mesh pipes for the beam saber holder joints on the backpack. The first kit to include a preview of all the previously released kits from that anime series in the instruction manual.
Fully transformable kit. Includes "swivel" display base with storage compartment for extra parts and adapter for Mobile Armor mode.
Color variant of HGUC-012. Includes marking sheet with EFF and Titans symbols. Later reissues have the pelvis part B7 molded with a rectangular hole to accommodate an Action Base 2.

info.notes: First HG kit to use double-jointed elbow parts previously used in Master Grade kits, which would later on become the standard in HG kits. First release included Advance of Zeta Guide Book. D plate runner molded in KPS instead of ABS in later reissues.

series.name: Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans

info.notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-056. D plate runner molded in KPS instead of ABS in later reissues.
Fully transformable kit with three modes, including a "Middle Form". Includes "swivel" display base with storage compartment for extra parts and adapter for Mobile Armor mode.
Either of the two units can be built at any time. First HGUC kit to provide parts for the creation of multiple variants. First 1/144 Dom to use a clear visor and adjustable monoeye.
Fully transformable kit. Includes adaptor part for HGUC-048.

series.name: Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam -A New Translation-

Color variant of HGUC-062. Fully transformable kit. Includes BA-1 display base.
Features extendable arms. Includes parts to create three different head configurations (two standard type and one commander type).

Uses almost no polycaps on the vital joints (only on the waist, hips, ankles, and accessories). Includes BA-1 display base and adapter for use with HGUC-013 or HGUC-018 to re-enact fight scenes from the OVA. Released to commemorate the 15th anniversary of Mobile Suit Gundam 0083.
Color variant of HGUC-064.

series.name: Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans

info.notes: Parts variant of HGUC-057.
First HGUC kit to incorporate a separate pelvis joint that allows forward and backward hip movement. This feature would later on be used in the HGUC and other HG lines.

Uses the D plate runner of HGUC-067.

Color variant of HGUC-091. Includes beam sword effect part and different beam machine gun.

First kit to be released from the After War timeline (HGAW) and the first kit to be released from outside the Universal Century.
First kit to be released from the Future Century timeline (HGFC). Includes transformable Core Lander and clear orange "God Finger" hands.

Redesign of HG-04 with improved articulation and proportions. Transforms via parts-swapping. Includes non-transformable FXA-07GB Neo Core Fighter and Action Base adapter for G-Fortress mode that doubles as a spare parts holder.

First Gundam not to be part of any official timeline. Also the first HG kit to feature non-functional beam saber handles since HGUC-038.

Based on Hajime Katoki's redesign for Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn. Includes marking sheet with E.F.S.F., A.E.U.G., and Londo Bell markings.
Includes transformable Core Lander, "Super Mode" head, and clear green "Shining Finger" hands, "Giant Hand" and "Shining Finger Sword" effect parts.

Includes clear red "Master Cloth", "Darkness Finger" hands, and "Giant Hand" effect parts and display base for Fuunsaiki, plus a clear pink Master Asia figurine. Transforms into Normal Mode via parts-swapping.

Uses runner as storage for unused hand parts.

Includes beam gatling gun from Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn and a clear display base.

Color variant of HGUC-101 with additional F and G plate runners.

Released to coincide with episode 5 of the OVA. Transforms via minor parts-swapping. Includes BA-1 display base with MA mode adapter plus handles and support peg to accommodate most 1/144 scale MS kits in MA mode.
Parts and color variant of HGUC-103. Transforms via parts-swapping.
Molded in Gundam Unicorn colors, despite being marketed as a Gundam ZZ kit. Includes two different antennas, two different chest parts, and two different pairs of front leg parts.
Support unit for HGUC-130 and most 1/144 scale kits. Holds up to two MS kits with the removal of the propellant tanks.
Fully transformable kit. Uses the F plate runner of HGUC-138.

info.notes: Includes an RH-35E Riah 35 Draken-E with two different arm configurations.

Parts and color variant of HGUC-151.

Includes adapters to mount two 1/144 scale mobile suits and different mounting points for Action Base.
Includes optional Stürm Booster.
Includes swappable hidden arms, wires and support stands for the Beam Hands.
Part of the HG All Gundam Project and the first kit to be released from the After Colony timeline. Fully transformable kit.
Color variant of HGUC-140. Includes extra marking sheet and both rifles of HGUC-140 and HGUC-150.
First kit to be released from the Late Universal Century timeline. Not transformable unlike its 1/100 scale HG or MG counterparts. Includes non-transformable Core Fighter.

First release under the "Revive" project. Redesign of HGUC-001 with better articulation and improved proportions. Includes marking sheet for Units 108 (Kai Shiden), 109 (Hayato Kobayashi), and 203 (from Mobile Suit Gundam Battlefield Record: Avant-Title).

Redesign of HGUC-021 with better articulation and improved proportions. Released to coincide with the 35th anniversary of Gunpla. Beam Javelin and Gundam Hammer sets were sold separately with Gundam ACE.
